repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: This collection contains material related to the dealth penalty abolitionist work of Judith "Jude" Filler in Texas.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence Judith Filler sent to David Lee Powell which was later returned by Powell to Filler and letters from other individuals incarcerated in Texas and their families. It also consists of other materials related to the criminal justice system and the Death Penalty.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Judith Evelyn "Jude" Filler was born in Ohio in 1949, graduated Antioch College, and received her MBA from Simmons College. During a later move to Texas for her career in business, she became a volunteer for Amnesty International. Filler subsequently served as Amnesty's state coordinator against capital punishment and become executive director of the Texas Alliance for Human Needs, a coalition of grassroots groups seeking social justice and change. In addition, she was a member of Friends Meeting of Austin and highly involved in the community for many years.

As part of Filler's work on the Death Penalty, she visited and corresponded with individuals incarcerated on Death Row. One of those individuals was David Lee Powell, convicted in a 1978 murder of a police officer. Powell remained on Death Row for 32 years until his execution in 2010. As she sought to abolish capital punishment, Filler and Powell became friends.
Following an extended battle with cancer, Filler died in 2016.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. Portions of the collection may contain recent administrative records and/or personally identifiable information. Please contact an archivist for more information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were donated by the Texas After Violence Project, arranged by Mark MenjÃ­var in 2023.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Judith Filler Papers, 1991-2010. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Filler Papers).

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is currently unprocessed and is not yet arranged. Individual items may be difficult to find.
